channel.title: What is your favorite arcade game?
channel.description: Title says it all. Personaly, i'd say that The House of the Dead series is my favorite arcade games. The music was excelent, the bosses were cool (not very original though) and the story was awesome. I liked the Magician, he hurls fire and he doesn't afraid of anything. Also, Teh Silent Scope is the boss.

item.source: What is your favorite arcade game?

item.title: What is your favorite arcade game?
item.dc:creator: Marb
item.description:
Plunked down many a quarters on games like Donkey Kong, Pac-man, Centipede, Dig Dug, Tron, etc… but the ones I probably spent the most on were Hard Drivin’ and it’s sequel - some of the first games to feature 3D environments and force feedback steering. It was the next best thing to driving a real car.

…geez, I’m old

Read full topic

item.title: What is your favorite arcade game?
item.dc:creator: The_Mindfucker
item.description:
Psyborg:

I love the House of the Dead series, but was never able to get anywhere in it, because I’m lousy at video games. Luckily, there was always Typing of the Dead, so I could find out how the epic storyline ended.

Goldman flies away

item.title: What is your favorite arcade game?
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
Combine:

For the latter, I never bothered picking anyone up, just sped around exploring the city until the timer ended. Funny thing is I never tried GTA.

That’s such a waste of moneh xD
.

item.title: What is your favorite arcade game?
item.dc:creator: KMCA
item.description:
in no particular order

DDR Extreme (had the best songs in my book)
Silent scope (1 not 2)
area 51
Time crisis 2

and from my forgotten title list
some mech game (very GUNDAM like and had twin joysticks)
and ‘blazing’ something, it was an awesome western sidescroller with some rose tossing rich guy for a boss.

Imonfire:

I so need to find those.

In arcades, the latter is like, the most common cab evar. There’s one in ever arcade I go in. The earlier one is pretty rare these days, I have that on PC, and the Dreamcast version of the latter.
.
